name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Salzburg - The Pitter

reviews.text: Spent an enjoyable night here recently. The room and bath were large and the bed the best of ten nights recently spent in Central Europe. The only negative about the room was that the in-room safe did not appear functional. Included breakfast was a bit above average. The location is only fair, you will walk a number of blocks through some less interesting parts of Salzburg to get to the city center. Overall, a decent choice of lodging in Salzburg.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: We stayed her for 3 nights after being in France and Germany.
reviews.title: Our Favorite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay in the Crown Plaza "The Pitter" in Salzberg. The service and attitude of the staff were second to none. It was the best service I have received in a hotel by far. My usual experience is that you will find one or two staff that stand out. I found that nearly all of the staff went to high levels to ensure are needs were being met at all times. Nothing was too much. After speaking to one of the managers to congratulate him on his staff, he told me the hotel has a new manager and that his emphasis is to make the Crown Plaza stand out in Salzberg as the jewel of the crown when it comes to service. I would definitely recommend this as a place to stay, especially if it is your first time. I loved the stay.
reviews.title: Felt like I was wearing a crown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights just before new year. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk away from the town centre and is about 10 minutes walk from the main railway station. The reception were extreamly helpful on arrival and their prompt service on deptature enabled us to leave with the minimum of delay. Our room was a good size with a comfy bed. Very clean (as most Austrian hotels are in my experience) with a complimentary bottle of water and tea & coffee making facilities (not that common in Austria although this is an international chain hotel).
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was very good. Very wide continental selection together with hot sausages, American style bacon, scrambled eggs plus, rather strangely, rice and chicken wings! Service at breakfast was very good with attentive staff. There is also a beer keller in the basement but it closed at 11pm so any late night drinking has to be conducted in the smallish plaza bar on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: Would suggest that anyone arriving from the airport takes a taxi - was only 10 euros plus tip not much more than getting the bus - then you have to change or walk from the station.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel
Salzburg.....a Beautiful City with Friendly People
reviews.text: Salzburg is a lovely city and it was a shame we only had a couple of days there. So much to see and do. The Festung Hohensalzburg fortress is fantastic although gets busy in the afternoon so get there early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are back after a six nights stay during the Christmas week and we all feel that Crowne Plaza was a really excellent choice. We are two couples and a boy of 11 y.Our rooms were exactly as we asked for.One smoking and one non-smoking. The double room was not very spacious but comfortable enough with a HUGE bed, a small seating area with two LOUIS XVI chairs and a table between, all facilities -ironing table- trowsers ironing machine, coffe-tea-chocolate making machine complimentary every day , complimentary bottle of mineral water every day ,chocolates, a litte bag of cookies and small sweets on Christmas Eve, bath robes, sleepers and additional toileteries items (shaving foam etc.) on request. The family room had also a huge double bed and a rather small for the boy(he was comlaining almost every night) with a second room as dining room with a big table and four LOUIS XVI chairs, where we mooved the boy's bed and it it was like a small suite.All furniture in very pleasant light colours. Very clean. Personell extremely helpffull and responding at everything we were asking for IMMEDIATELY (train timetable and prices,bookings, itinerairies informations,info for open pharmacies on Christmas day,EVERYTHING). breakfast spotless with a huge variety even champagne. Distance from old town very convenient , about 15 min. of very pleasant walk across the river and a fantasic view of Salzburg and the Castle, we did not use taxi almost never even when returning late at night (very safe).Once we needed a taxi we paid 4.50 euros.We definitively reccommend this hotel to our friends and of course we would come back again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here last week with my wife and two children(10 and 6) and had a wonderful time.Hotel room was very spacious and the service from all the staff was without blemish-truly excellent.However if having a pool is very important to you it is very small and when my two daughters were in it there was not much room for anyone else.And one word of warning-the small bottle of wine,pringles and chocolate bar which appears in the room every day is not complimentary.Only the bottled water is!

reviews.text: Inside the hotel are 2 restaurants, the Rainerstube which is open Wed-Sun 18.00-24.00 and the Pitter-Keller which is open daily 11.00-24.00. We ate at the Pitter-Keller twice, must say that the food was good, the portions big and the service very good. I really recommend it.
reviews.title: Not Overly Impressed

reviews.text: Trip Advisor needs to institute 1/2 star ratings. This hotel was above a 4, but not quite a 5. We stayed here during a recent 2 day trip to Salzburg. While the hotel is not in the "old town", it is within walking distance and it was actually nice to stay in a "real" neighborhood, rather than in the overly-cute tourist zone. The hotel offers all the amenities of a solid American chain. Our bedroom was huge (king-sized bed), spotless and comfortable, and the bathroom was larger than the usual European lot. What really stood out though, was the exceptional service we received from the front desk staff. Not only were they extremely pleasant, but they were very knowledgeable in the area and were ready at all times to offer any help which we required.
reviews.title: A Great 4 1/2 Star Hotel
The Sound of Music City
reviews.text: Salzburg may be livelier in the Summer when the city is flooded with tourists, but we found it absolutely dead after 8 p.m. The Crowne Plaza offers 24 hour room service, a big plus in a town that shuts down after a certain hour and best, it's right across the street (catty corner) to the one restaurant that was open until 3 a.m.!!! We arrived in town almost at midnight and were happy to find this very local place (definitely not a tourist restaurant)...and the food was excellent!

The only reason why this hotel earned a 4.5 rather than a 5 was because of the tv situation. There were plenty of channels, but most were in German. We noticed very few German speaking guests at the hotel and the 3 or 4 English channels--(two of which were CNN and BBC) were basically news and not much else. As we speak Spanish fluently, we ended up watching Italian television which was easy to understand. However, in a town that has extremely limited nightlife, tv selection is very important and unfortunately, this is the one area of the Pitter with which I was not satisfied.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service !!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Otherwise, I would return to the Pitter with no hesitation and the hotel is highly recommended for a stay in Salzburg.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: I took my mum, dad and husband to Salzburg for the Christmas markets. As my folks are from the southern hemisphere they fancied a "real christmas" - so I had to produce snow, Christmas music, Christmas Trees and of course the markets. On top of this as it was my treat I needed a great but reasonably priced hotel. What are the chances in Europe?
reviews.title: Great hotel - great value

reviews.text: Anyway I got a fab deal on the Crowne Plaza Pitter and couldnt believe the low cost. After reviewing all the comments on tripadvisor, I thought we might just be ok and maby I had just got a GREAT deal.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

description: Step inside the classic 19th-century facade and grand marble Lobby of Crowne Plaza Salzburg-The Pitter. Our dedicated staff can help you finalise your banquet or conference arrangements, and they're on hand to provide local sightseeing knowledge. Energise yourself in the Fitness Centre or discover a taste of Austria in our bars and restaurants.Many of the city's attractions are under 20 minutes' walk from Crowne Plaza Salzburg-The Pitter. Stroll to the Cathedral on the Domplatz square where you can listen to the summertime classical music festival, or sip mulled wine at the annual Christmas market. We're next to the Congress Hall, just 900m from Salzburg rail station and less than 5km from Salzburg Airport.
